metadata.name: Golden T
metadata.description:
3072 x 1536 are the dimensions of this piece. I've always been interested in ambiguity. This is abstract, though our mind really wants to link it to something real, a texture or even a place. Of course, the viewer will bring their own experiences and interpretations to the painting, but ultimately, the true meaning of the artwork lies in the eye of the beholder.

I find that abstract art allows for a unique kind of freedom and creativity. Unlike representational art, where the artist is bound by the constraints of depicting a specific subject or scene, abstract art allows the artist (and the audience!) to let their imagination run wild and create something truly unique and original.
